sen.j: 四条 隆謌（しじょう たかうた、文政11年9月9日 (旧暦)（1828年10月17日） - 明治31年（1898年）11月24日）は江戸時代末期から明治時代にかけての日本の華族、陸軍軍人。
sen.e: Takauta SHIJO (October 17, 1828 - November 24, 1898) was the peerage and soldier in Japan from the late Edo period to Meiji period.

sen.j: 官位は陸軍中将正四位勲二等侯爵に昇り、元老院議官・貴族院議員を務める。
sen.e: His official rank was lieutenant general (army) Shoshii Kun nito (Senior Fourth Rank, Order of the Second Class) marquis and served the Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders or Senate) and member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers).

His official rank was Marquis and Lieutenant General, Shoshii Kun nito (Senior Fourth Rank, Order of the Second Class) and he was a member of the Genroin (Chamber of Elders) and the Kizokuin (the House of Peers).

sen.e: Takauta proposed to the government in the end of Edo period as a Court noble of Joi-ha (supporters of expulsion of the foreigners); however, he was brought down by a coup and temporarily deprived of his official rank.

sen.j: 明治に入ると中国四国追討総督・大総督宮参謀・仙台追討総督・奥羽追討総督平潟口総督などを務め、明治2年（1869年）7月に陸軍少将に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, he served as Chugoku Shikoku Tsuito Sotoku (governor of expelling in Chugoku and Shikoku), Daisotoku no Miya Sanbo (staff of chief governor prince), Sendai Tsuito Sotoku (governor of expelling in Sendai), Ou Tsuito Sotoku (governor of expelling in Ou), Hirakatako Sotoku (governor of Hirakatako), etc., and was appointed as an Army Major General in July 1869.

In the Meiji period, his posts included Chugoku Shikoku Tsuito Sotoku (military governor of Chugoku and Shikoku); Daisotoku no Miya Sanbo (staff officer for the commander in chief); Sendai Tsuito Sotoku (military governor of Sendai); Ou Tsuito Sotoku (military governor of Ou); Hirakatako Sotoku (governor of Hirakatako); and he was appointed Major General in July 1869.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）1月には大阪鎮台司令長官に就任、明治7年（1874年）4月に名古屋鎮台司令長官に移るが、明治10年（1877年）5月には大阪鎮台司令長官を兼ねた（同年中に兼職を免ぜられる）。
sen.e: He was appointed as General of Osaka Chindai Army in January 1872 and then as General of Nagoya Chindai Army in April 1874, but served concurrently as General of Osaka Chindai Army in May 1877 (he was relieved from serving concurrently as General of Osaka Chindai Army in the same year).

He was appointed Commander of Osaka Garrison in January 1872 and transferred to Commander of Nagoya Garrison in April 1874, though he served concurrently as Commander of Osaka and Nagoya Garrisons in May 1877 (he was relieved from serving as Commander of Osaka Garrison later the same year).
